Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Us!”
Reviews.Author: tombargirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Griffon was the perfect location for us. We were able to drive straight to the hotel, park our vehicle and spend the weekend either walking or using the public transportation without hassling with traffic, parking, etc.. The Saturday Farmer's Market @ the Ferry Building is a great way to start the weekend. The hotel room was a little small but otherwise fine considering we spent little time in our room. The front desk staff were very pleasant and made us feel welcomed. We also had breakfast & dinner at Perry's. Food was very good! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A gem on the Embarcadero”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust
Reviews.Content: Hotel Griffon is our hotel of choice when planning a weekend getaway to see a couple of Giants games. We are always greeted warmly by the front desk staff and valet people. The beds are very comfortable and our room has always been super quiet - my two most important criteria. It's a short walk to the ball park. Perry's downstairs is a great little restaurant but there are many more in the area. Great location for more than just baseball!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn M
Reviews.Content: This is such a beautiful hotel in San Francisco! It is tucked away on a quite street but it also backs up to the water. The rooms were very clean and it had nice extra touches like turn down service and ladies makeup remover towelettes, silly but the little touches like that always make it for me. It was great we were able to walk to AT & T park from the hotel also. Everyone at the hotel was nice and friendly. Loved the room we had it was gorgeous inside. We will so be going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location, Walking Distance to AT&T Park”
Reviews.Author: pragjohn
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was very friendly and we loved the location right across the Embarcadero from the Ferry Building. Perry's restaurant shares the bottom floor and the acclaimed restaurant Boulevard is almost next door. A nice, easy walk down the Embarcadero to AT&T Park. There's easy access to the Ferry Building stop of the F trolley line that takes you straight to Fisherman's Wharf. The rooms are a bit small, but nicely decorated and pleasant. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Getway”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: We came for our anniversary/birthday celebrations. Kevin at the front desk was wonderful -- upgraded us to a Bay-view room and sent a bottle of wine to our room to help us celebrate that first night. The rooms are smaller sized, but its a boutique hotel, everything you need is there (and first-rate), and it is across the street from the Ferry Building and close to AT&T park and BART. Give it a go. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: FresnoBartel
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a weekend in San Francisco! We stayed at the Hotel Griffon on the Embarcadero. We walked to the Giants game and back. Really conveniently located. Right across the street from the Ferry Building. Restaurant with a view of the Bay Bridge! Everything was great! The staff could not have been more helpful (let us drop off our car and luggage early, got us a table by the window for dinner, etc). We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel~”
Reviews.Author: MrsE101511
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my husbands birthday! Kevin at the front desk was wonderful! He helped us with finding our places to go and even put a cab bottle of wine in our room to help celebrate my husbands birthday! The room was adorable and very clean! The service from all the staff was WOW unreal the best! We will be back to this Hotel~ It's close to the market, fine restaurants, and the Piers!

Reviews.Title: “A Total Gem--Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: reinaruth
Reviews.Content: I've been attracted to this small, intimate hotel for some time now and finally was able to get to stay there on the last Saturday in March, and truthfully, never wanted the visit to end. In fact, I wanted to extend our stay, but my husband was the obstacle here. Otherwise would have stayed at least one or two more nights. The room, the view, the service, the comfort, the staff, the location, the decor, --even the onsite restaurant, Perry's, cozy and romantic, which we did not try because of previous reservations elsewhere, but intend to have dinner at next time-- made this one of my most memorable hotel stays. One I wish to repeat as often as I can! Olivia at front desk was lovely and assured us a great room. Even our housekeeper, May, who we met on check in and again at turndown service, was as lovely as everything else. My only concern with all this well-deserved high praise here is that we will have everyone wanting to stay here and it may be hard to book, or find the room we want not available for our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gottogonow
Reviews.Content: First, let me start by saying Olivia, at the front desk and the doorman/valet, Julio were outstanding. Both made us feel welcome and Julio helped us with our public transportration questions. Both of these folks were knowledgable and took the time to see if we needed anything to make our stay perfect. Our room was 218 overlooking the bay. It was a beautiful view but for an additional $80+ I would rethink it next time. As we were on the 2nd floor facing the bay and the street we really couldn't open the windows. There was absolutely no privacy to leave the curtains open. For one night stay and few opportunities to really enjoy the view it really was wasted on us. Back to our room. It was absolutely lovely, very small, but very well thought out and had everything we needed. It was immaculate. Our bed was comfortable and the room was " pin drop" quiet even though we were facing the street. The compact size was not a problem for us as we have traveled extensively in Europe and it is the norm. The hotel itself is in a great location a block away to public transportation capable of getting you just about anywhere in the city you need to go. Julio parked our car and we spent the rest of our visit using the street cars and two cab rides. This morning, Saturday, we walked over to the Ferry Building and shopped at the farmers market and craft fair, had a great breakfast on a bench with a bunch of other early risers and walked a block back to the hotel to get our car and head back to the delta. We loved this hotel and plan on coming back in the near future. Next time we will give the restaurant a try!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: krumcan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the downtown area and was surrounded by great restaurants. The cable cars, wharf, and transit system are within a two block walk. The room was very comfortable and larger than any other room we've stayed in there. The staff was great! They helped me with tours and locating attractions to see. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel that was very good. We stayed three nights and really enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: sm8ckd0wn1
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Griffon. The front desk manager, Matt, made sure our stay was memorable as we were there to celebrate our engagement and anniversary! The service was top-notch from the front desk to the bell boy who helped us with our luggage. Our room also had a wonderful view that overlooked the ocean, Treasure Island and the Bay Bridge. The hotel is right next to a bar called Perry's which was nice. My fiance and I will never forget our stay there and we look forward to going back for future anniversaries and/or celebrations!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: djhenryhall
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here while on a business trip. The hotel is close to many key locations such as the convention center. The hotel staff in general was super nice and knowledgeable. The front desk graciously upgrade me to a suite with killer views of the water. The room came with 2 large TV's - one in front of the bed and another in front of the couch. The room had plenty of room to set up a mini office and the internet connection was fast. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: perryfamilyAZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in January. The hotel is in a great location close to the Embarcaedro and the Financial District. The hotel is a small boutique type hotel, not a good hotel for familes, but perfect for those on business or couples. The hotel room was small, but had all of the needed ammenities. It appeared the hotel was recently renovated. The bed was awesome. The elevator is very small and slow, but this is expected due to the age of the building. The hotel staff was awesome and easily took care of bag storage and airport transporation. They offer a free towncar shuttle in the mornings to different areas of the Financial District. The hotel is located very close to the Bart station as well as numerious restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a big BUT”
Reviews.Author: Achim_Gleissner
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week, the hotel is nicely located close to Embarcadero and the Financial District. Friendly staff, authentic interior, nice restaurant. They have some nice rooms with bay view. However, there are other rooms... I had one with two small tinted glass windows facing to a pit within the building. Two floors down, the exhauster from the kitchen runs very noisy 24/7, so you have noise plus the kitchen smelling. The roof is some two floors up, it's hard to tell if it's day or night in that room. Would have asked for a different room, but we had some guests at the same time and I left the good rooms to them. The hotel is to be recommended, but you have to ensure that you get a room facing the street or the bay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with AMAZING views!”
Reviews.Author: JordanPelaez
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife over a weekend in December and it was perfect! Matt Swenson was most helpful during the reservation process. The location cannot be beat. We had a GREAT view of the bay bridge and directly across the street from the Ferry Building, where foodies gather for pretty much anything you desire! Service was spot on and the property was a lot nicer than we thought it would be from the web -- a pleasant surprise to say the least!

Reviews.Title: “looks nice but...”
Reviews.Author: 100percentislandgirl
Reviews.Content: I spent three days at the Griffon Hotel in October with about 15 professional colleagues. The Griffon has an awesome history and story and its location in the Bay area, in the heart of everything, makes it a popular place to stay. On first appearances the hotel, its distinct style (oriental impressions) and trendy, unpretentious vibe is indeed a winner, even if it is small. On closer inspection though, things start to crop up that make you reconsider whether this place is worth the money; First thing- The hotel's front doors are always open. Trust me Brothers and Sisters, this is NOT a good idea; the smell of sewerage from the street invades the lobby and lingers around like an unwanted guest. What is even worse is the fact that the hotel's restaurant is right beside the lobby. Imagine getting a whiff of that as you sip your pinot and dig into your 'Catch Of The Day'...yummmmmmm. Second- The rooms are small, as in, you literally cannot swing a cat in there (though beautifully designed) and poorly ventilated. The carpets smell musty and the window seat looks a little worn out and it sits above the super loud AC unit. Third- I dont know about anyone else, but my window (on the third floor) was facing what i think was the fire escape (the window was foggy and made with that thick textured glass makes everything outside look all distorted like). So in addition to having no view, I also had no natural light coming into my room. I'm telling you, i would leave my room at around 8am, thinking it was gloomy outside because it was so dark in there. Imagine my surprise when i noticed that it was sunny outside! The interior designer here was a clever one because to counter the gloom in the room, they installed an artificial 'natural light' just above the bed, to make dim wits like me feel like it was sunlight shining down from the heavens onto my face. Needless to say, when i discovered otherwise (i.e. a whole 5 minutes after coming into the room for the first time) i seriously was not impressed. Fourth- The price was too high for such a small room, with musty carpets and no breakfast. I am especially cross about the no breakfast thing though. I am guessing, no, I am positive that guests at this hotel are actually paying for the location and the concept of awesomeness. I will admit that from the looks of things, this hotel does have a certain charm to it, but i WILL NOT be caught paying this much for a hotel that clearly needs an upgrade, a facelift and some love.

Reviews.Title: “We have mice, but otherwise we're great.”
Reviews.Author: RealUSCfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 4 days in October 2011. Had a bayfront room, small but nice. Typically what you'd expect in this area. Area was great, close to F line cable cars which will get you everywhere else. View from room of Bay Bridge was fantastic. Staff was friendly. Only one issue- I awoke to a mouse on my night stand eating a granola bar I'd left there. Also realized that unusual noise I heard during night was a mouse dragging a sticky trap to free himself. Ruined a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: Texaskitty6
Reviews.Content: We chose the Griffon Hotel based on other reviews and the proximity to the Ferry Building. The location was fantastic and getting around was very easy as the trolley stop is only 50 feet away & the Ferry Building was literally across the street. Since we were catching an early ferry for a wine train trip this was very convenient. The rooms are tiny, but well appointed & comfortable; however if you are claustrophobic, be sure to request a room with a view! We didn't have one but were only there for 1 night. The staff was friendly & very helpful with restaurant recommendations & trolley schedules & routes. If I were staying there again, I would definitely request a room with a bay view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, fabulous night of sleep!”
Reviews.Author: diver782
Reviews.Content: Within minutes of entering the Hotel Griffon last Friday night we were greeted no less than three times in the first minute by staff. Matt Swenson checked us in, and could not have been more pleasant and helpful. He had suggestions for dinner, told us about the farmer's market the next morning in the clock tower, and knew what time all the Fleet Week air show activities began. He escorted us to our room, which had a beautiful view of the water and Bay Bridge. The room was immaculately clean and perfectly appointed, and the bed was beyond comfortable. Despite being directly above the busy Embarcadero, not a sound came through the windows, which helped add to a perfect night of sleep. Matt greeted us by name the next morning and checked our luggage for us so we could enjoy the day without having to lug our suitcases everywhere until we left the City later that evening. This hotel is located within walking distance of everything yes just far enough away from the hordes in Union Square to be absolutely perfect. Perry's, the restaurant attached to the hotel, was a great place to relax, too. This is a fabulous boutique hotel, in a great location, with outstanding staff. Thanks again, Matt!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wellington31
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were upgraded to a top-floor (5th) water front suite. It was amazing with great views of the Bay Bridge. The hotel lobby is very cute with a great restaurant attached. Located on the Embarcardero, the hotel is a great location to visit waterfront attractions. However, trying to return to the hotel in the evening was difficult as there was a lack of cabs and all the trolleys were full.

Reviews.Title: “Postcard perfect”
Reviews.Author: Maureen024
Reviews.Content: Our 5th floor suite had postcard perfect water views of the Bay Bridge, Treasure Island, and the Ferry Building. It's the closest hotel to the Ferry Building, which is a foodie heaven. Super convenient location. The hotel's street address/front door is Steuart Street, but the back of the hotel is on the Embarcadero. Although our room overlooked the super busy Embarcadero, street noise wasn't a problem. We walked to pedestrian Pier 14, just across the street, and had great city skyline views.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time....”
Reviews.Author: tl4tl
Reviews.Content: After an extensive search online I decided to book a room for 5 days in San Francisco. There were issues with my reservation and Matt the manager was AMAZING! He took care of our reservation and upgraded us to the King Bay View on the 4th Floor that faced the Bay Bridge. It was the most beautiful view I have ever had in a hotel. The rooms are small, but the ammenities are great! Perry's Restaurant downstairs has a full bar and menu PLUS they have room service. We ended up eating 3 times at Perry's. I do agree the desk staff could have been more friendly but Majorie is very sweet so I tried to deal with her mostly. When we checked out I left my clothes hanging in the closet and she called me to tell me what I had done. Luckily, I wasn't to far and was able to turn around. Again, this is a great hotel, great value, good food, smaller rooms but really how much time do you spend in your room on a vacation in San Francisco?!? Oh Valet is perfect...for the money front row parking and you can just drop the keys off at the desk if no one is outside. We called for our car everyday 10 minutes before we were ready to leave and it was always on time. Thanks Hotel Griffon!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, small room..........”
Reviews.Author: CWJ-CPC
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Griffon Hotel in San Francisco as the first stop of our two week trip to the US, having booked 4 nights on Travel Republic. We found that the Receptionists were not particularly welcoming and checked us in without providing any information on breakfast or really anything else about the hotel services. We also found that they were not particularly knowledgable when we asked them for information on getting to the Beach Blanket Babylon show, a well known San Franscico show we had tickets to or about a strike on the BART, which we had heard about on the news. Our booking included a "Continental breakfast" and when we asked the unhelpful receptionist she said they did not have a continental breakfast option - this in fact worked in our favour and we were able to spend a specified amount each morning on breakfast which we were not then charged for! Our room (411) was relatively small and dark with the basin in the bedroom rather than the bathroom. It had two windows which overlooked a internal "shaft area" which seemed to accommodate all the air conditioning extractors and other peoples windows. Not only did this make the room dark, it also meant that there was noise from the extractors. The room did grow on us - the bed was comfy and we had never planned to spend a great deal of time there, as we were out exploring the city. Breakfast was served in Perry's, the restaurant that is part of the hotel. Breakfast was good - particularly the extra options available for brunch on the weekends. The service provided varied each day. We also ate at Perry's on the Sunday evening after we got back from the evening tour at Alcatraz - nothing special but it was tasty and quick. The location was good for being close to Emberacardo Station and other public transport options. It is also walking distance to the Alcatraz Ferry and Pier 39 (15 - 30 minute walk depending on how fast you go), but overall not particularly central to any one thing/attraction. We were leaving early on our last morning to fly to Las Vegas, so we asked if we could deal with the bill the evening before. The receptionist was not able to tell us what was on our bill and appeared to not want to deal with us properly. Having said that she did work the bill out and it was put under our door at some point during the night. Overall, we were disappointing with the customer service, but the room grew on us and was sufficient for our purposes as a base in San Francisco. We probably wouldn't stay there again, as we expected a higher level of customer service and a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Drilling, Small, & Rude”
Reviews.Author: sports
Reviews.Content: My husband an I arrived at the hotel on Sunday, September fourth about 1 hour before check in. We parked in one of the 2 spaces they have out front. I went in to let them know we were here understanding that a room would probably not be ready. When I entered the small lobby and walked up to the desk the young lady behind the desk did not even say hi nothing she just looked up at me. I informed her of our stay and she told me there were no rooms ready. I said okay and asked about having our car parked and if we needed to access the car during our stay could we. She could not tell me where they parked the car and said they could only get it for us and it would take 15 to 20 minutes to get the car. We took our luggage out of the car and John (the only nice person) took our car to the unknown lot. We thought we would just wait in the lobby till our room was ready. After waiting only a few minutes Matt the manager called us to the desk to let us know a room was ready. We went to the room which had a maintenance man fixing a light fixture in the bathroom and a drilling noise that made the walls shake. I went back to the lobby to ask about a room without drilling and possibly not a maintenance man. The same young lady, Julia, was at the desk and told me there were no rooms without the drilling available for our stay. I asked to speak to Matt the manager. She told me to go back to the room and he would call. A few minutes later Matt called and said there were no rooms that did not have the drilling and not to worry as it only goes from 10 am to 5 pm. I told him we would leave then and he said fine to go ahead and leave as he could not help us. There were no apologies and no attempts to solve the problem.No I am sorry let's try and work this out. He just told us to leave. We gathered all our stuff, went downstairs and I told them how unhappy I was and that the room was not ready that there was someone in the room fixing a light. He could not have cared less and we left. We went a few blocks down the street to the Inter Continental Hotel and we were in a bigger, beautiful and cheaper room in 15 minutes. This was a birthday getaway for my husband and I which I mentioned at the Griffon and got no response. The Inter Continental sent up a lovely pastry selection with Happy Birthday wishes! What a difference in customer service and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: tgsapo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Griffon for 3 days in a standard queen room last week. The hotel and room were very well appointed. It was not the smallest room I've stayed in, but not the largest either. It had an in-room coffee and tea maker. Biggest complaint was the lighting. Since the opaque window looked at four walls, there was very little natural light in the room. Otherwise, there were three small lamps. With every light on in the room and bathroom, it was still pretty dim. No other complaints, though! Service was great! Location was FABULOUS! Within walking distance to everything. Peet's coffee and tea with fruit in the lobby every morning. Perry's Restaurant had a great patio area with a view of the Bay Bridge--happy hour too! Overall a great stay. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but definitely 2-3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicholsfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: I may be a bit jaded as a 150+ night hotel customer, and thus lean towards consistency, comfort, etc (ranging from Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Fairmont, to Hilton Garden Inn and Courtyard)... I felt like I was staying in a friend's spare bedroom here. Nice location but the room was strange (the sink, mirror, etc. are at the foot of the bed, for instance; the TV is mounted high on the wall and there is no closest (just a wooden wardrobe); room comes with a portable fan (does that mean no AC?); one power source that I can find (I need 4 for all my stuff to charge), etc... bit rinky dink but I just need a few hours to crash.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lou_Mike
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Griffon - excellent location on the Emberacardo and a friendly staff combined with very nice rooms. We arrived for a weekend stay with our 2 grown up sons. I'd booked 2 standard rooms and the receptionist immediately gave us an upgrade to a suite for one of the rooms. The standard rom was very small, but excellent quality. Our suite was huge and had a roof terrace thrown in too - great bonus. There is a friendly bar downstairs where we easily got talking to locals who used it as a neighbourhood bar. We all liked the location - just opposite Pier 14 close to the Financial District and the Main Ferry Terminus. We were very glad we hadn't stayed around Fisherman's Wharf which was tacky. Loved San Francisco - great city.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: LindaCMalone
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Griffon during the San Francisco Marathon. Being a native San Franciscan, I was amazed that such a wonderful hotel existed that I did not know about. This was our first visit, but we will be back. The staff are very helpful and friendly! The hotel was immaculate and very well kept. The lobby offers computers and coffee and the adjoining restaurant, Perry's was a wonderful place to gather for food and drink! Our room was was a King, Bay view which was wonderful. As in many big cities, the room was small, but well laid out and very comfortable for two people. Although overlooking a busy street, there was no noise at all. The soundproofing was very effective. The hotel is very accessable via public transportation. The BART station is three short blocks away (very walkable). I would highly reccommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Quirky, & Quick-Hop to AT&T Park”
Reviews.Author: jcindc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about calibrated expectations. If you are looking for resort accommodations or an expansive suite, it will not work for you. But if you're comfortable with a quaint and quirky boutique experience, close to the Embarcadero and AT&T Park, this is a viable option at a reasonable price point. Just stayed two nites in a deluxe king room. As other T/A reviewers have commented, this room is very small, if not bordering on tiny. I did not have a tape measure but I guesstimate it was no more than 200sf, with a 7' x 6' bathroom carve out housing a tub/shower and toilet. The low sink/vanity are in the sleeping space, as well as the king bed, two nite stands and a desk, so there is little room to move about. The TV is a good size flatscreen with Comcast CableCard, but it is mounted way above the vanity near the ceiling in an awkward viewing position-- too bad because a simple swivel stantion would fix this. There is also a small refrigerator under the vanity, and a coffee maker too. The rest of the quirkiness vibe continues with a light well window that berths a small bench seat, which really becomes a luggage rack as there is no other space to stow besides a small, open closet. There is no dresser, and drawer storage is limited to two, tiny, floor level drawers in the window seat and the nite stands. Oh and don't miss the lighted sconce above the toilet, which faces a long, door-mounted mirror so you can watch yourself as nature calls! Some T/A reviewers have commented about a musty smell, but there is an awning window high above the right corner panel of the light well that you can crank open. The downside is you will hear pidgeon warbling very early in the morning if you do, On the quaint side, this is a 100+ year old building, with a long history that goes back to the barbary coast days and an owner who was a bootlegger. The elevator is 30" wide, cramped, and slow,,,,,so take the steps and wind up in the bar! And for the eco-types, score bonus points for sustainable design, environmental, and energy efficiency initiatives that were purportedly enhanced in a 2007 renovation, albeit I was suprised by a sliding thermostat relic for the HVAC. The exposed brick wall is also obtrusive, and if I were management, I'd slap a nice wall mirror on it to open up the room. On the plus-side, Peets coffee, fesh fruits, newspapers, and WiFI are complimentary, albeit the latter was SLOWWWWW....room was clean....front desk efficiency and hospitality were exceptional! Bottom-line.....these cramped quarters are good for nite or two and best for single travelers, or a couple with limited essentials. The restaurant (Perry's) is convenient and busy.....the food was good (we had Sunday Brunch), the service was spotty, and the drinks fell somewhere in between. Of course with Chaya and The Boulevard within whistling distance, there are options......or take a little stroll to California Street and try Perbacco or Tadich for a great dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a great part of the city”
Reviews.Author: Suzana4
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Griffon for 3 days and enjoyed the San Francisco. Eventhough my room had no view (well, walls dont count as a view) the room was nice, clean and comfortable. Restaurant in the hotel was full all the time so I used a room service which was proffesional. And I loved free wifi! Even Hilton does not offer that! The greatest think about hotel is the LOCATION - its in Financial district but only few metres away from the sea and piers. I would also recommend to rent a bike (in front of nearest hotel on Market street) which makes sightseing easier and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it but didn't love it.”
Reviews.Author: reeverbeaver
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for the Hotel Griffon having booked direct from the UK and getting top class service over the phone. This was our honeymoon and so we booked a bay view suite on the top floor. The suite was very nice but the bathroom was disappointing for the money. The view from our room was of the Bay bridge and was quite simply stunning. The hotel was rather let down by some of the reception staff who seemed disinterested and didn't engage with us at all. This wasn't true of all the reception staff but you tend to remember the bad. The car valet however was exceptionally chatty and interested in how we had enjoyed our stay. The local area has loads to offer and in hindsight we would have booked more than the two nights that we opted for. The trip to Alcatraz is well worth booking in advance it sells out, it was really interesting and worth the inevitable queues! We would recommend the open top city bus tour for a good overview, this gives you a good starting point when planning your time in San Francisco. Remember to have the correct money for the cable cars as they do not give change.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Hotel with Down to Earth Attitude”
Reviews.Author: MichPhil63
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. It was definitly upscale, however they were very down to earth and very friendly. The service was excellent and the rooms were very nice. We really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value for location and quality. We will be back!"”
Reviews.Author: kris081
Reviews.Content: We were attracted to the Hotel Griffon as a smaller hotel in a rehabbed building. We were not disappointed. The room, while small, was well equipped. Having the sink outside the bathroom took a little getting used to, but it turned out to be quite convenient and made the faciilities easier to share. The furnishings were up to date, of high quality, and comfortable. Even though our room had windows on the Embarcadero only 3 floors up, we were not bothered by street noise. The staff was helpful and friendly. With all the competition, the restaurant on the ground floor held its own in San Francisco. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others and hope to return on another visit to SF!

Reviews.Title: “Incomparable location and exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: papillonRWC
Reviews.Content: A friend and I wanted to spend a week-end in SF and not have to deal with the traffic/parking. We picked the Hotel Griffon primarily for its location on The Embarcadero. It is a charming boutique hotel whose friendly staff make you feel immediately welcome. Our room had a gorgeous view of the bay, Treasure Island/Yerba Buena Island and the Bay Bridge. We walked to the Ferry Building for the Saturday Farmers Market - unbelieable! - and were grateful for the refrigerator in our room to store the cheese and wines we bought there. Ferries and historic streetcars to other areas are a short walk from the hotel. The restaurant in the hotel, Perry's, is quite good and offers a lovely outdoor seating area facing the bay. The hotel has complimentary Peet's coffee and tea in the lobby every morning. The staff was most helpful about places to go and how to get there. Print your boarding passes at the two PCs in the lobby. $5 gets you a pass to the Y next door. We will definitely return to this charming venue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rocko4415
Reviews.Content: This ho. tel was clean and gorgeous. Yes the rooms are smaller but they couldn't be more efficient or have more character. The gentleman that checked us in was extremely helpful and polite and we had a great experience. Great location and nice and close to AT&T park. Will definitely stay again, LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Giants game”
Reviews.Author: Oatmans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Griffon for the sole purpose of going to a day Giants game at AT&T Park. The hotel is a great option for walking to the ballpark, strolling along the bay and trips to the ferry building. My husband, 5 year old son and I stayed in a King room. The room was on the smaller size, but most in SF are the same. There was a nice window seat that was a great place to sit and read. The hotel staff was extremly friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, comfortable, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnitaMW
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our night in San Francisco at the Hotel Griffon. We were in SF for a Giants game and a dinner near the Ferry Building. Location was important to us, and this location was perfect. The room was very well-laid out for a tiny room (they make good use of the space). We were upgraded to a view room, and the view of the Bay Bridge was lovely. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and quiet (even though our windows overlooked the Embarcadero), and we could have walked the three blocks from BART if we hadn't decided to bring our car into the City. Valet parking ($45) was just a tad more than overnight parking at a garage, and it was worth it to us. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: KCbadger
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and found HG to be quiet, comfortable and with great proximity to Embarcadero, the Wharf, Financial District and AT&T Park. The staff was extremely helpful. In fact, when my daughter arrived for a day visit from San Raphael, her tire went flat just as she pulled up to the front of the hotel. The valet parking staff CHANGED her tire for her. Unreal! Perry's Restaurant adjacent to the hotel lobby was perfect for breakfast and lunch (we at dinner elsewhere). The only minor issue: the one and only elevator is extremely slow and small, but stairwell worked well and I needed the exercise anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nhtraveler63
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved this hotel. It is very close to the Ferry building so we could walk to the restaurants and shops!! Very nice staff at the hotel, clean rooms and easy to coonect to the airport and Amtrak. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “A great, renovated hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: MrstixSalem
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone said "HI" to us and answered all of our questions. The rooms are typically very small, as this is a downtown property that is quite old. Our room on the 4th floor had everything we needed. All of the modern things, but the charm of the hotel was well preserved. Our room (403) was unique, as the floor was sloped a few inches from the door "up" to the bed. It was not a problem for us, but it was interesting to see the closet door bottom cut on a slight angle to accomodate the slope. It made the room even more charming and special. No street parking, so valet is the only thing available. A block from the Ferry Terminal and lots of restaurants in the area. The hotel restaurant was very good, too. We would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Griffon's limo service made SF visit even more enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: Gnaws
Reviews.Content: Hey Julio & Marco - I just wanted to send you a quick note thanking you for making my brief visit to SF much more enjoyable. Your flexibility and latitude in meeting my crazy interview schedule and personal requests was SO appreciated. It's practically unheard of to find your kind of congenial service these days. You're a credit to your profession and most certainly to The Hotel Griffon. Looking forward to seeing you on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: Santacruzergal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely, historic hotel after deciding to pass on the awful property that Priceline booked us into on a "bid" (read - $1.00 less than published rate). I found the Griffon on a Boutique Hotel search of San Francisco and was able to get a great internet rate. We opted for the lowest available rate, which I am sure translated into an "inside room" (no view). In the reservation request I noted that we were celebrating my Husband's birthday and would appreciate any consideration ....when we arrived they had already upgraded us to phenomenal Bay View room with a dead on view of the Bay Bridge and Treasure Island. In addition, there was a split of a reputable French champagne producer on ice as well as 2 flutes and a note congratulation my husband on the occassion of his Birthday. All this and parking was free as we drive a hybrid. The room was lovely with all the appointments you could wish for (MP3 player - plush robes - flatscreen, etc.) but it was their amazing staff that really made our weekend! I would recommend this hotel to nearly everyone (maybe not for small children)! Great location, great view, great staff and great rate - what more could you ask for! Hotel Griffon rocks!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, no conversation with reception”
Reviews.Author: zerosas
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with very central location for business user such myself. intersting episode in reception while trying to make conversation with recepcionist from Russia. she took offense with my comment about how difficult it is for people from east europe to drop the accent due to the way the country schools teach english (i'm european as well). anyway just a warning, don't mention the accent to the receptionist. overall very good hotel indeed.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful SF experience in this gem of a boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: galenaonthebay
Reviews.Content: My parents visit from the east coast each year and usually stay on our boat at South Beach Harbor. This was the first year in over ten years that they decided to stay in a hotel in San Francisco. Finding the perfect hotel was really important! I wanted a classic SF boutique hotel in an awesome location. Hotel Griffon was that and much, much more! First I did my internet research and made a call to check on rooms and rates. Matt, was so incredibly nice and helpful that I decided to stop by and check the place out. The warm and inviting atmosphere of the lobby and adjoining bar and restaurant are hard to describe. You just get a really friendly and inviting feeling upon entering the hotel. Each staff member we met was just as wonderful as Matt. The location on the Embarcadero across from the Ferry Building is ideal! There are plenty of restaurants close by, it's centrally located for walking and there is a YMCA two doors down. Perry's Restaurant, on the ground floor of the hotel, is fantastic. They offer a full menu of really reasonably priced entrees, something for everyone. We ended up having two dinners and one breakfast at Perry's; it's really convenient! I highly recommend the Bay View Suite; it's very spacious with a great layout of a bedroom area and separate living room space with killer views of the Bay, Bay Bridge and Ferry Building. The standard rooms offer the same view and would be fantastic if you don't plan on too much hanging out in the room. We chose the suite which worked out perfectly for the two of us and my parents to have a drink and hang out before dinners. I will definitely book a room for my parent's next annual visit as well as recommend this gem of a boutique hotel to other friends and family! To recap: * Wonderfully helpful and friendly staff (Matt was great!). * Classic SF boutique hotel; a gem. * Perfect location; convenient, safe, great area to walk and explore, plenty of restaurants. * Convenient restaurant and bar in hotel. * Bay View suite is really spacious, great layout, killer views. Hotel Griffon and the staff are wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...”
Reviews.Author: mg2765
Reviews.Content: My only regret about this hotel is that I didn't get to stay longer. I was there for one night. I was upgraded to a suite and the room was beautiful. Large, especially for a city-hotel. I also had access to a beautiful private deck. The room was clean, the staff was friendly, and the location was great. The only downsides were that the water pressure in the shower was very low, and the restaurant opens late, 7:30 a.m. As an east coast traveler, I was awake at 4:00 a.m and hungry. The only option was to go out at that time to get some food as they don't have vending machines in the hotel. So, if you're going to want to eat something before 7:30 just bring some food with you to your room!

Reviews.Title: “great location, excellent service, superb experience”
Reviews.Author: Jan01234
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Griffon on several different trips -- rooms ranging from the suites to mini-suites to bay-view to interior (i.e. no windows) rooms. Each room is unique and delightful in their own way. Service is impeccable, breakfasts are reasonable. Parking is somewhat inconvenient and expensive (but norm for SF) and the valets give you great clues for cheaper weekend options. The suites facing towards SF are the best for the $$, in our opinion, but we also liked the intimacy of the interior rooms. What an amazing hotel. Certainly our first choice for return visits.

Reviews.Title: “Impecable and Reliable Service”
Reviews.Author: jmarieg
Reviews.Content: Service is a must when I travel and there are few hotels where the service is better than what is provided at the Hotel Griffon. It is so wonderful to be right next to the Embarcadero and the market. The view is spectactular.

Reviews.Title: “The 'just right' sized hotel”
Reviews.Author: torontiff
Reviews.Content: I like these smaller boutique hotels - each staff member then feels s/he's a host. Restaurant was really good, waitress Margie was very accommodating, great concierging by front desk, and BEST hotel bathrobe I've ever worn.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Experience was absolutely PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: tiffanylawson
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Griffon on many occasions, all for different purposes and every time has been fabulous. We have stayed for a romantic getaway to the city, a night's stay after a Giants game, with a large group of friends for a party, and with 25 family members for an 80th Birthday Celebration. Every time that we have stayed at the Hotel Griffon they have been very accomdating and made our stay a true pleasure. The location is perfect for us, we love to walk around the city and this is such a neutral spot for all the places we like to see. The market on Sunday mornings on The Embarcaderro is always fun to walk to, but our favorite is the short walk over to the Giants Stadium for a game. The boutique atmosphere is very romantic, espcially the suites with the private balcony or the rooms with the view of the bay, it is absolutely breathaking. I have attached a few photos from one of our stays as well.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing hotel in a fantastic location - Great views, accommodations, service and value”
Reviews.Author: KellyM_B_10
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! My husband and I stayed for a romantic SF weekend in this adorable boutique hotel and absolutely loved it! It was clean, completely updated/renovated, large rooms with VIEWS! Our room had the sleeping area, plus a seating area, AND had an unobstructed view of the SF bay, bay bridge, Treasure Island, across the bay...everything! We could not believe it! Bathroom was large and modern. The staff was so nice and friendly - we met the head manager Norbert (super nice guy) and all the staff was helpful in giving suggestions, offering free coffee in the am, and making us feel so special (for us, this is one of the big benefits of staying at a smaller, more personal hotel vs. a huge hotel). If you go, you don't want to miss walking to the SF Ferry Building's HUGE Farmer's Market. From the hotel, you can literally walk and all over SF. Also, you should have dinner at Chaya Restaurant (literally less than 1/2 block walk). Delicious food, shopping, excellent hotel, and spectacular views galore all at a great price - what else could you ever want?!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ABQJen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on a business trip. It's in a great location, right on the Embarcadero. The front desk staff is beyond friendly and helpful....in fact, the concierge ran down the street to hail us a cab! The room was tiny, but adequate for my purposes. The walls are a little thin and you can hear a bit of hallway noise, but overall I really enjoyed my stay. The chocolates on the pillow were a nice touch! Make sure to ask for a room with a view...I ended up looking into an alley way. My colleague had a great view of the bay, though!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sclsmiles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Griffon the weekend after Thanksgiving for a wedding we were going to in San Francisco. I would highly recommend this hotel. The service was great and check-in was speedy. The bed was comfortable and the room very clean. Great location too! We were able to walk to Union Square, only about 3/4 or so miles away. The only complaint is there were no robes in the room. I figure if that's the worst of my complaints (an easy fix... hint, hint Hotel Griffon... =), then this hotel is doing something right.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in the Heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: ericsteff
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Hotel Griffon four times and each time I am more amazed at the hotel and the service of the employees. I was most recently there to attend a conference with my law firm colleagues and I chose the Hotel Griffon over many other landmark hotels because of its proximity to both the Financial District and AT&T Park (where the Giants were busy winning the World Series!). My room overlooked the San Francisco Bay and was just spectacular. Very clean and neat and had everything I needed. The staff was extremely accomodating, including finding me a cell phone charger after I lost my own. I was even given access to a wonderful Board room that allowed me to get work done while waiting to meet colleagues at the equally magnificent Perry's restaurant downstairs. I love that it is so close to everything but still has a small boutique hotel feel. The restaurant is really an added plus but mainly I just can't say enough about the service. Everyone was so friendly and made me really appreciate San Francisco in general. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues. It really has everything I could have asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Elegance, one of a kind San Francisco experience”
Reviews.Author: Jocchipinti007
Reviews.Content: I don't often take time to write a review but my family and I had an amazing stay at the Griffon. This is a charming top drawer hotel. I travel extensively around the world for business and liesure and know the subtleties that make a difference between a 4 star and 5 star experience. The staff were extremely helpful but not annoying, the rooms where reasonable size with high ceilings, amazing views of the bay. Location was prefect for business or leisure. Near down town, but right near Marina. The day for the family included a bike ride along the marina, pier 39, a ride to golden gate bridge, hot fudge sundays at Ghirardelli Square then an evening play within walking distance of the Hotel. Before check out the next morning I walked to Coit Tower too! Awesome time, thank you for the FIve Star experience Hotel Griffin!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: midget104
Reviews.Content: Stayed at property while in area on business. Room was sent up nicely with plenty of space at the desk area and wireless internet to due my work. Beds were very comfy and it was quiet all night for a good night sleep. Property is very eco-friendly right down to the bath room amenities (love the soap with the hole in the middle). I travel and stay at various hotels on the west coast twice a month and would recommend this hotel as one of the best. The staff is wonderful, friendly and very helpful with any needs, and the turn down service is a nice touch. This is my go to hotel for the Bay area and my "Home away from Home".

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: revluc68
Reviews.Content: great location, wonderful staff, small European style property. This hotel offers lovely rooms, some with great views of the bay, a friendly staff that always welcomes you back and works very hard to make sure every need is taken care of for you. as a business traveler most of my life is is nice to find a small quality property and avoivd the hassles of a "chain hotel'. Will always look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT doesn't do it justice - will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: BrockvilleTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Nov 13-16. I booked the "bed & breakfast" package - which gives you a $40 credit in the restaurant every day of your stay - and you can use it at anytime (easily covers 2 meals). The comfort food menu offers lots of choices and everything I had was very good. Enjoying dinner on the outdoor patio on the water overlooking the lights of the Bay Bridge was spectacular. Hotel staff were helpful with maps, tour suggests and coordinating transportation to the airport. Customer service was outstanding. I stayed in a Non-view queen bed room - it was not as small as some the reviews lead me to believe. There is a small desk and chair .. with free internet hookup. The bathroom sink was in the room rather than with the tub and toilet. They drop off chocolates with their turn down service. There is a small safe (large enough for a notebook) and umbrella for your use. The room was very clean. The location is good too ... a safe neighbourhood within walking distance to many attractions and streetcar. Next time I visit SF, I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: hapeetrails
Reviews.Content: When arriving to the hotel I first noticed its delightful charm from the outside of the building, when entering the remodeled and updated contemporary lobby we were greeted right away by the hotel staff Olivia, and another gentleman(forgot his name) but both were very helpful and welcoming! The parking for us was a breeze, we were able to utilize the parking meters right out front on the hotel, and I believe it is free parking on the weekends, which was great. We reserved a standard room which was a bit small, but you have to keep in mind the old layout of boutique style hotels the rooms will be smaller, but by no means was it lacking. The room was clean and cozy, a great fit for us. I love the fact this hotel is environmentally friendly, and had many green features within the hotel. Perry’s Restaurant has a full breakfast, lunch and dinner menu with a bar, attached directly next door to the Hotel Griffon, which was tasty. The view of the Oakland Bridge is absolutely beautiful from the 2nd floor window (a great photo op). The location is off the beaten path of all the hustle and bustle of other busy areas of the city, but is right around the corner form the embarcadero and not far from Fisherman’s Warf. Overall we loved our stay at Hotel Griffon, and will stay again in the future! FYI check the weather report before you leave. People assume the weather will be chilly, but we were pleasantly surprised with record breaking 75-80 degree weather in November!

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice...”
Reviews.Author: jen_h_scotland
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel - rooms are small but very cosy. No view - only a brick wall which was a bit disappointing. Decent nights sleep - however we could hear the noise from the bar and were woken on 2 nights around 2am by people shouting in the corridor - but if there is a bar on the premises I suppose it can only be expected. Good location if you like walking - perfect for popping over to the Ferry Building for morning coffee and a muffin! The only downside was that I did not get my security deposit back until I returned to the UK - this was 1 week and 1 day after leaving the hotel. I had phoned and was told it would only be 3/4 business days, however this was not the case. Just make sure that if you are booking into this hotel, you have plenty of money and that you are not relying on the deposit to be credited back to your card quickly.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: voyagerAustralia
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night here, but would return anytime. Location was a perfect walk from Chinatown, the rooms were absolutely georgous with great toiletries,but the service was the BEST. The staff were really helpful and even allowed me to store my 5 bags there when I went to Sausalito for the weekend. I could not recommend this place more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: FujiSyuuske
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Griffon Sept 25-28. The hotel is located just a few blocks from the MUNI/Bart station so we accessed it easily after landing at SFO Airport. It is a few steps away from the Ferry Building and one of the last stops along the F cable car line to Fisherman's Wharf. Location was fantastic if you are not planning to rent a vehicle. The hotel was quaint but the rooms were satisfactory for the two of us. Hotel provides tea/coffee in the mornings and water throughout the day ++. Overall, we would definitely stay here again due to it's convient location. It is not as hustle and bustle as fisherman's wharf but close enough to public transportation to access tourist locations (Union Square, Chinatown, Wharf etc.). One minor glitch was that our keycards did not work after the first night as the hotel thought we were only staying for one night, but this was rectified quickly after visiting the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Fits the bill for location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: LondonPetunia
Reviews.Content: The Griffon is in a great location near the Ferry Building and within walking of plenty of shopping and plenty of bus and trolley stops. Staff are friendly and efficient. Rooms are very comfortable and clean, although some are very small indeed, but if you are only sleeping in them it's not a big deal. Handy sports bar/bistro on the ground floor. A good value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: rehamilt
Reviews.Content: Impressive lobby - elegant and subtle; adequate restaurant off lobby with tremendous, outdoor seating weather permitting. Small, dark rooms with somewhat worn fixtures and furniture; average but clean, small bathrooms. Maid service arrived at 4:30 p.m., when we had dinner reservations at 7. When we complained, one woman at front desk expressed sympathy, while the other appeared frightened. An odd reaction. All in all, however, the excellent location - financial district, port authority, public transport, etc., make it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Excellent Hotel - A must stay”
Reviews.Author: BullTraveler
Reviews.Content: You will be amazed and overwhelmed by the Hotel Griffon from the moment you set eyes on the hotel. Walk thru the front door and you are greeted by a very friendly staff, Kevin and team are very welcoming and only enhance the enviroment. The check-in is easy and seemless as can be. The entire staff from the front desk to room service was more than friendly and welcoming. Attached to the hotel is Perry's Restraunt, what a surprise, typically the hotel restraunt does not impress me, Perry's was amazing, an awesome dining experience and very reasonable, not priced to guage the hotel guest. You know its a great place to eat when the locals are dining. Lindsey and the rest of the bar staff provided the best service I have had in ages. Well done Hotel Griffon and Perry's staff. Thanks again for a wonderful stay, Rodney & John

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Redman27
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through travel zoo and received a great deal. We did have a minor issue with our package, as the hotel claimed our $40 credit could not be used for parking, and we were under the impression it could be. Booking through travel zoo we expected to have just an average room, ours was rather small with little to no day light from window that faced internally. Not for the claustrophobic but it was clean and unique, and being a historic property would be expected. There were muffled sounds from the adjacent restaraunt (which I would recommend for a play on home style food). However as a whole based on the price and location, it was fine. The location to the ferry building, embarcadero is excellent. Also within walking distance of wharf and other attractions and its right on many public transit lines.

Reviews.Title: “tries but fails”
Reviews.Author: physician
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this hotel because of the excellent location and the friendly front desk staff. However, the puported "luxury executive suite" which we booked was probably one of the more depressing hotel rooms that I have stayed in. As protrayed on their website, the room is decorated in brown tones, which is not necessarily bad but in our case was actually dark, drab, shabby, and appeared to be decorated with a mindset towards hiding dirt rather than being appealing. The furnishings in both the living area and bathoom are very cheaply made. It was a very depressing room to come "home" to or spend extended time in. BTW also, the internet service is very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Booked for one night months in advance to...”
Reviews.Author: Leonidas1
Reviews.Content: Booked for one night months in advance to be told on arrival I was to be moved to a sister hotel a mile away due to overbooking. They had also only decided to try and inform me of this when halfway across the Atlantic and thus no where near accessing the email. Not impressed despite them paying for a taxi to the sister hotel they were not all too concernced over the inconvenience caused and the costs incurred by moving. Obviously can't comment on the rooms nor stay but despite booking months in advance not impressed with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular time - are booked again for this year!!!”
Reviews.Author: rebadog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Griffon in 2009 - had a wonderful experience there - wonderful staff, comfortable and tasteful decor - and extraordinary location - just cross the street - you will see the Bay Bridge and find yourself on the Embarcadero - fantastic walking area right on the Bay - We loved it so much that we booked it again for this year and will each year for our annual San Fran vacation - as we have 2 kids that live out there - we are so happy that we have discovered this hotel - everything was wonderful - can't think of one thing to change...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: always_traveling305
Reviews.Content: About a 5 minute walk from BART's Embarcadero Station, which makes very easy access to and from SFO, the location is excellent. I had done my homework first so I knew the rooms were small and that I probably would not have a view. Not a big deal considering that I just needed a place to spend the night. I arrived early and was checked in quickly with a smile. The staff is amazing, I couldn't have been happier. Yes, the room was small but well appointed and quiet. The flat screen TV was H-U-G-E and there were a zillion cable stations, just like at home. Also it was very quiet and comfortable with really nice bedding. A nice bar sized mini fridge and wall safe just added to all rest. My package came with breakfast and the restaurant downstairs is of high quality, many who dine there are not staying at the Griffin. Also I had a water view table at the window, and again the service was excellent. At checkout I checked my bags and had an entire day in SF until taking BART back to SFO. A great in/out experience. Many thanks to the Hotel Griffin

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THE HOTEL AND THE PEOPLE THAT WORK THERE ARE AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: smlamagra
Reviews.Content: I have only good things to say about this Hotel. All of the people that work there are amazing and make sure that you are always having a nice stay. Its it also perfect walking distance to Pier 39 or even to Bart. I will stay Here again. 5 plus stars for me on this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience-EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Shelleee12
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived our experience with The Hotel Griffon was fantastic. As other reviewers state the rooms ARE small, but oh so comfy! Having a sink in the sleeping area worked well for us as one could be showering and the other could finish getting ready. Having spent a bit of time in the lobby on the computers I could hear the staff interact with each other as well as other guests. One thing that impressed me was how well they treat each other, which carries over to how they treat their guests. Our Concierge, Connor, was a doll! If he didn't know something he would find out the information within moments. He went above and beyond and I can honestly say he saved our trip for us. (tip to management...keep him...he's a 10+!). Our airline didn't offer reserved seating and wanting to be in the first boarding group so we could sit together, we found ourselves in a bind. Do we miss our trip to Alcatraz or ?....problem solved. The front desk staff took our information and when we returned we were handed our boarding passes for the first group! We spent our last of three nights there in the on site restaurant, Perrys, watching the Superbowl. Best meal of our entire trip, if only we had known how good the food was from the first day! In all our travels we have never had such a perfect, completely relaxing, stay. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickelCa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here overnight in a standard queen room. We got this room for a great price when we booked at least 14 days in advance through their own site. The rooms are small, but they are not unbareable. We actually liked it being smaller than a normal room. You don't need all that extra space unless you are going to live there. The room was nicely decorated and clean. The hotel in general was nice and there is a restaurant and bar right inside as well. The valet guy was very nice and a great help. Though I would just park across the street myself next time to avoid the $45 charge for valet, or use the Muni's. Overall really nice hotel and we will definitely stay here next time we visit SF. Cons: Front desk staff doesn't seem happy and friendly, they just get to the point. But whatever I don't need the enthusiasm. Valet price too high. The shower water trickles out, good luck to any woman who wants to wash her hair. My husband even complained of this issue. I believe this is part of their "green" philosophy, but it doesn't make sense when you just have to take an extremely longer shower than usual to wash up. Then, we did not notice this until the next morning, but we were woken up by the crying child next door and could hear the parents talking, so apparently the walls are paper thin. Other than these minor issues we did enjoy our stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great times!”
Reviews.Author: daniigirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of Hotel Griffon's suites, and the view took my breath away. I arrived after a long, stressful day of travelling and seeing the view of the Bay Bridge lit up at night literally turned my frown upside down! After showering and using their eco-friendly products (big plus!) I stepped outside and realized I was walking distance to many popular San Francisco attractions: Chinatown, Little Italy, the Embarcadero, Fisherman's Wharf/Ghiradelli Square and the Financial District... just to name a few. Plus, the staff was friendly and their complimentary breakfast was perfect! I would stay here again in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time with my girlfriends in an amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: daisy4684
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Hotel Griffon and it definitely won't be the last. We were greeted by an incredibly nice front desk staff upon check in. They were so personable and gave us directions to pretty much everywhere. I stayed in a suite with a few of my girlfriends to celebrate a birthday and it was the perfect size for us to all get ready each night. We had the most amazing view of the bay and it was such a quick walk to bart. The lobby was so classy and everything felt so clean. The continental breakfast was also a nice treat in the mornings. We all had such a wonderful time in the city and we owe most of it to Hotel Griffon. I hardly ever write reviews but this was such a great experience I just had to! Definitely recommended for romantic getaways and groups of friends.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking View and Overall Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jendeja
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with Hotel Griffon the moment I got into the suite. Our room overlooked Embarcadero and the Bay Bridge was popping against the blue sky. I went to the window which fully opened and saw two parrots (I swear they were parrots) fly by and could hear them squawk. It was truly a very special moment. The staff was very friendly while we were there and they had a good breakfast available the next day. You can tell that they get a lot of international travelers because they had real yogurt. I give Hotel Griffon a 5 start rating for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room with a View. Of a Brick Wall”
Reviews.Author: himark35
Reviews.Content: The Griffon is a small boutique hotel in a great location in San Francisco. If you're into small boutique hotels, you might really like this place, but it's not for me. The rooms are exceptionally small, and mine afforded a view of a brick wall. My closet had exactly four clothes hangers. The fuzzy TV had surprisingly limited channel selections (e.g. I couldn't find CNN or CNBC. Air conditioning was weak, and the slow elevator can really only accommodate two people with luggage. On the plus side, everyone was quite friendly, and the location is great. So, if you're only in town for one night, this would be an ok place to land. But, if you're going to be here for a few days, the walls could start to close in on you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Great Service, Super-fast Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: IndiaHydTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Griffon is located in one of the most accessible places of the city. It's just near the Bay Bridge, so you can take a leisured walk next to the bay. Second thing, I loved - The internet! I was on a business trip, so working from my hotel was unavoidable. I'm grateful that the internet was reliable and super fast. What I loved the most about the hotel is the front desk - I was there in a bad scenario. I had a Maestro card, which wasn't one of the common forms of debit cards in the US. They had a policy of not accepting cash. But, there was this person called Marjorie who checked with her boss (late night that was!) and checked me in with a cash payment. Also, I had a complaint about the clock in my room that two frontdesk helpers totally forgot about, but Marjorie was swift in getting that fixed! Thanks! :) Also, they have good tie-ups with local tour companies. I had a good city tour of SF through the hotel. The room was decent enough for a single occupancy. I liked the interiors. What disappointed me was the complimentary cab service in the mornings. They can't accommodate cab requests for many people at a time. So, that's something you can't rely upon.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: yellowsneakers
Reviews.Content: Great location, great style, and great views. The hotel staff was very accommodating, but the reason I gave the service 4 and not 5 stars is because the service in the restaurant (Perry's) was awful! However there are plenty of other fabulous places to eat near by, so avoid Perry's and you will have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good spot for a trip to SF”
Reviews.Author: sammath_naur
Reviews.Content: Nice place that has also the necessary stuff and friendly smilly staff. It's a good location in SF for must things, though in the evening it can be slightly dead area. Luckily with the subway close by it is not really an issue. Small rooms and a bit in a need of a renovation, but clean and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice For The Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: wanderingbutnotlost
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights during a business trip. The location is very good. It is near the Ferry Building on The Emabarcadero. The "F-Line" Street Car takes you easily to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel has charming character. The room was small, but comfortable for a short stay. The king bed was very comfortable. The room amenities were excellent. The hotel is very environmentally GREEN friendly. The hotel staff were exceptionally professional, friendly, helpful and courteous. There is valet parking and the fee was discounted for a hybrid car. The hotel lobby has a WiFi hot spot and I was able to work on my laptop for several hours with no connection issues. I was not able to get a wireless connection from my room. There are also two free access computer stations in the lobby. There is a Lincoln Towncar service on site, it costs more than a taxi, but the additional expense provided very prompt, clean and friendly transportation service. It was about $45 to the airport and the tip is NOT included. The room rate includes continental breakfast in a restaurant next door to the hotel. This arrangement is OK, but I did not find the server to be as friendly and helpful as the hotel staff are. The server did not acknowledge me upon my arrival and I had to ask for what was else was available from the kitchen - eggs, etc. knowing that there was an additional charge for anything beyond the continental breakfast. He appeared to be annoyed that he was interrupted during his morning set-up tasks. If this one person cannot set-up and provide service to customers, then the restaurant should add another person to help.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Griffon is a charming boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lloydbtc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Griffon is a lovely place to stay when visiting San Francisco. Located on the Embarcadero, it provides a panoramic view of the Bay. There is a lively restaurant/bar located next to the lobby, where people meet in the late afternoon. The location of the hotel is especially suited for people who like to walk, jog, or bike along the waterway. We took a long walk all the way down to Fisherman's Wharf from the hotel. It was delightful! Also, there are excellent restaurants just steps from the hotel, and of course, all the famous places of San Francisco are at your doorstep. Our room was cozy and perfect for us. It had the feeling of a European hotel. The large bed was ultra comfortable and we appreciated the room's refrigerator where we were able to keep a leftover salad. Also, it was surprisingly quiet, even though it overlooks San Francisco Bay. We slept very well. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. In short, we highly recommend the hotel Griffon for a place to stay when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Customer focus? No thank you”
Reviews.Author: argos01
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience with Travelocity. Reserved 3 night. When arrived at hotel reception they had canceled my reservation same day. No previous notice. My credit card charged and had no reservation. Talking to them. Sorry, sorry, waist of time. Will refund my money. Just avoid Travelocity. Hotel Griffon contribution. Offering me just one night in an smaller room for a higher price. I was touch. What a customer focus, what a wiliness to help. No thanks. When at test people show their real style.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: ohuru
Reviews.Content: The staff was very warm and welcoming, and the location was ideal for our trip. A few issues with the room, nicely decorated but not well thought out in terms of function. The can light above the sink gave excellent exposure to the top of my head. That in combination with the mirror witch was almost above the sink made it impossible to shave. The television received only local stations with tolerable quality. Lastly, the ventilation was bad. The air supplied was air conditioned, so either cold or suffocated.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZigZag5
Reviews.Content: Good hotel stay - rooms are quite nice and up to date. Hotel has a lot of character to it. Very centrally located in S.F. Close to restaurants and was only a 20-25 min walk to either the ball park or Pier 39. Hotel was good value for the money. Parking was expensive but not much you can do about that as parking seems to be expensive everywhere in the city. Unfortunately our room had a view of the back alley fire escape, but the room itself was nice. The restaurant downstairs (Perry's) was pretty good. It served a decent continental breakfast. Has a nice view of the Embarcadero. Hotel also provided complimentary internet usage. One negative is that the bellhop service was a somewhat chaotic. Eventually had to go downstairs and bring my own bags up to the room as I was tired of waiting. Overall, it was a good stay

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Bay Area, CA but now living in the
Reviews.Title: “Used to love it, but now I don't”
Reviews.Author: AandN
Reviews.Content: Years ago, my partner and I stayed here during our wedding weekend. We loved it. So, in a return trip to SF for work, we stayed there. I think if we had gotten a bigger room and not gone for the great discount we may not have been so disappointed. But, basically, we got woken up at 4 AM by loud revelers (coming up from the bar to their room), the parking is still outrageous ($44/night), the staff always seemed overwhelmed, etc. Our small room was always too hot (nothing they could do, just bad design: a heat lamp in the bathroom was the only adequate light, the window didn't open), and the blankets were always slipping off the bed. So, despite the large flat screen, fridge in room, nice toiletries, decent shower, etc. I don't think we'll stay here again. Too many other options in SF to warrant it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, and value.”
Reviews.Author: JC00K
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Griffon on several occasions and have always had a pleasant experience. The greatest asset of the hotel is it's location. You are right next to the Embarcadero and can easily walk to the Ferry building and several great restaurants and bars in the area. Perry's, located right inside the Griffon, is an attraction itself. When I leave the hotel in the evening I often find a line of people waiting to be seated. I have only had breakfast and happy hour at Perry's, but I'm looking forward to eating there sometime. The service at the hotel has been very good every time I've stayed. The rooms are not the biggest, but they are fine for my purposes, and tastefully decorated with a flat screen t.v. I have stayed in a suite once, and that was very nice. Overall, this is a great hotel for the price and will provide a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Gunslinger42
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend in to the city for a quiet 4 day weekend to celebrate by return to the Bay Area from 10 years in the Army. A friend hooked me up with the Griffon, and it was the perfect place to stay. It had been a long time since I spent any time in SF and I remembered that neighborhood as being baron and not so fun. Turns out that the Griffon is in the center of a rebuilt hot-spot on the eastern side of the city. Quick walk to the ball park, nightlife and down town. The Hotel it self is small and not very assuming, but what it lacks in size it make up for in comfort and design. The rooms are small (as most city hotels are), but it was excellently designed and functional. Exposed brick and a great layout made it feel like I was in a much larger room. My stay was extremely comfortable and quiet and the staff went out of there way to point out cool places to visit in the area. Now that I live in DC, and travel to NY on business frequently, I stay in tones of boutique hotels. Few of the ones I've stayed in had the comfort and the quality that I had at the Griffon.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend get-away”
Reviews.Author: dgreattraveler
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Hotel Griffon. The property and neighborhood were charming. They call the area Restaurant Row because of the many top rated restaurants nearby. I do not know why they settled for Perry's - YUCK!!! Cheap food as well as cheap service. They say, "You get what you paid for." The hotel in itself was as elegant as the pictures are shown in their websites. The front desk staff was amazingly attentive. I returned late during my nights out on the weekends and still was greeted by the most friendliest night staff, Phillip. I highly recommend the hotel but unfortunately do not recommend the CHEAP restaurant. Breakfast service was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Embarcadero Location....lots of things to do in surrounding area.”
Reviews.Author: muybungco
